text: Alston is an extinct town in Fairfield County, in the U.S. state of South Carolina. The GNIS classifies it as a populated place. ==History== The community has the name of Joseph Alston, 44th Governor of South Carolina. A post office called Alston was established in 1850, and remained in operation until 1928. ==See also== *Spartanburg, Union and Columbia Railroad ==References== Category:Geography of Fairfield County, South Carolina Category:Ghost towns in South Carolina
title: Alston, South Carolina
